title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB:
The test.class is then put in subpackage\subpackage directory. This means running java command results in Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test.

Running either of the following command fixes the problem: ajc -d .
EB: Compiling with ajc should not create an additional "subpackage" directory.
SR: Compile the class using the following command: ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
